comments:
When debugging a J2ME application the following error occurs when first
connecting to the WTK emulator:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Mar 22, 2005 11:22:54.984
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Debug".
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
	at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.GenericSignature.getArgumentsSignature(GenericSignature.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MethodImpl.argumentTypeSignatures(MethodImpl.java:302)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MethodImpl.argumentTypeNames(MethodImpl.java:278)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIStackFrame.getArgumentTypeNames(JDIStackFrame.java:324)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIModelPresentation.getStackFrameText(JDIModelPresentation.java:1498)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIModelPresentation.getText(JDIModelPresentation.java:204)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.LazyModelPresentation.getText(LazyModelPresentation.java:101)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DelegatingModelPresentation.getText(DelegatingModelPresentation.java:158)
	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.DebugViewLabelDecorator$LabelJob.run(DebugViewLabelDecorator.java:326)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

Debugging J2ME apps appears to be completely impossible at the moment, as if you
 are lucky enough to get the debugger to connect without locking up the
emulator, breakpoints appear not to work consistently, (perhaps because they are
set in different threads?).

Ryan and I just saw this bug debugging Eclipse on IBM JDK 1.4.2. We were 
testing HCR in Eclipse and hit the same stack trace.

Our steps:
1. Create a field declaration: private String string = "foo";
2. Place a breakpoint on the field declaration.
3. Debug. The breakpoint is hit.
4. Change the value of the string literal and save (build).
5. We perform HCR and try to drop to frame, but we because we're over a native 
method, we're left with an obsolete method.
6. This exception appears in the log.

Looks like we're passing an invalid signature from an obsolete method.

Here's the exact stack trace we got on 20050330

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-03-30 16:53:58.409
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Debug".
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        at org.eclipse.jdt.core.Signature.getParameterCount(Signature.java:950)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.core.Signature.getParameterTypes
(Signature.java:1083)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.core.Signature.getParameterTypes
(Signature.java:1122)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MethodImpl.argumentTypeSignatures
(MethodImpl.java:298)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MethodImpl.argumentTypeNames
(MethodImpl.java:279)
        at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIStackFrame.getArgumentTypeNames
(JDIStackFrame.java:332)
        at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIModelPresentation.getStackFrameText
(JDIModelPresentation.java:1673)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIModelPresentation.getText
(JDIModelPresentation.java:213)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.LazyModelPresentation.getText
(LazyModelPresentation.java:153)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DelegatingModelPresentation.getText
(DelegatingModelPresentation.java:156)
        at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.DebugViewLabelDecorator$LabelJob.run
(DebugViewLabelDecorator.java:323)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Is this at all related to a bug I had reported against EclipseME last summer? 
See
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=988364&group_id=86829&atid=581073
for more information.

I agree that this looks like a bug on the part of the VM (it has returned an 
invalid siganture), but we should work around the problem.

Fixed in GenericSignature. Rather than throwing an illegal argument exception, 
we just return an empty list. It looks like this only effects presentation in 
the UI (i.e. method argument type names in the call stack).
*** Bug 97975 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
